title: Research Challenge
description: What research can the community fund that will assist in the direction of the catalyst project?

f6_assessments.q0: It is critical to be prepared for future challenges, such as quantum computers, and to otherwise keep on improving Cardano. The proposal attempts to do this through research.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe there are enough scientists in the community to come up with good proposals. The budget, however, seems way too small. In Europe, at most the entire budget will cover a stipend and legally mandatory pension and insurance payments of one PhD student for 18 months, or a postdoc for 12 months. That is not enough to get much meaningful results. To "test" the idea of community funding, the budget should be either at least full four years for one PhD student, or two years for a postdoc. To do significant meaningful research, the budget should be significantly higher.
f6_assessments.q2: Some of the criteria, such as number of proposals using the funded research, seem a bit premature: research and its adoption both take time.

importance: Decisions and directions are better made when information and data is available. Community funded research effort can add significant value
success: How many research papers that are funded are used in or to create proposals?
